channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Meta shares pop on revenue and earnings beat, better than expected forecast
item.description: Meta reported second-quarter earnings on Wednesday after the bell. Here are the results:

item.title: Japan confirms $36.8 billion currency intervention as weak yen pushes BOJ to hike interest rates
item.description: Japanese authorities spent 5.53 trillion yen, or $36.8 billion, to shore up the yen in July, official data published Wednesday showed.

item.title: Arm issues light earnings guidance as the company stops disclosing number of chips reported as shipped
item.description: After facing declines in chip shipment counts, now Arm is focusing on higher-value markets, including accelerators for artificial intelligence.

item.title: Uber to start using BYD cars in Europe, Latin America and develop 'autonomous-capable vehicles'
item.description: Uber plans to use 100,000 electric BYD cars on its ride-hailing platform, starting in Europe and Latin America, the two companies announced Wednesday.

item.title: 9/11 mastermind Khalid Sheikh Mohammad, 2 others charged in terror plot reach plea deals
item.description: Khalid Sheikh Mohammad is accused of masterminding the Sept. 11, 2001, terror attacks, in which the Twin Towers in New York City were destroyed.

item.title: I’ve been to 100 countries. I didn't expect to want to return to these 5
item.description: Travel enthusiast Todd Miller identifies the five countries that he had assumed would be "one and done" places, but that left him wanting to know much more.

item.title: Here's how much athletes at the Paris Olympics earn for winning medals
item.description: Aside from a medal, a stuffed toy of the Olympics mascot and an official event poster, some medal winners are accorded additional financial rewards.

item.title: Middle East on knife-edge after killing of Hamas leader in Iran; Israel's opponents vow retaliation
item.description: Iran has pledged to retaliate, but how it does so could determine how intensely the conflict escalates.

item.title: Meta’s Reality Labs posts $4.5 billion loss in second quarter
item.description: Meta's virtual reality and augmented reality focused Reality Labs unit recorded an operating loss of $4.48 billion in the second quarter.

item.title: Lithium giant Albemarle halts Australia plant expansion, reviews costs on weak lithium prices
item.description: The decision comes as the company reported a second-quarter net loss of $188 million, or $1.96 per share. Excluding items, it earned 4 cents a share.

item.title: Here's what changed in the new Fed statement
item.description: This is a comparison of Wednesday's Federal Open Market Committee statement with the one issued after the Fed's previous policymaking meeting in June.

item.title: Qualcomm beats estimates and phone chip sales are up 12%
item.description: Handset sales rose 12% on a year-over-year basis, which suggests that a deep slump in smartphone sales over the past two years is abating.

item.title: Why orange juice is so expensive
item.description: Orange juice futures are hitting records as growers lose millions of dollars annually. U.S. citrus production is plummeting amid weather and disease extremes.

item.title: Banks get bullish on the British pound despite the possibility of an imminent snapback
item.description: Sterling's recent runup comes despite traders pricing in the potential of a rate cut in August by the Bank of England.

item.title: Iran says Israel will 'pay heavy price' after death of top Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh
item.description: Iranian supreme leader Ayatollah Khamenei said in a statement that Israel "has prepared the ground for severe punishment with this action."

item.title: ASML shares pop 7% after report that U.S. will exempt allies from new China chip restrictions
item.description: Reuters reported that the U.S. is considering expanding chip export restrictions to China, but countries including the Netherlands and Japan would be excluded.

item.title: Bank of England rate cut is a close call even with inflation on target
item.description: Members of the central bank's voting Monetary Policy Committee are divided.

item.title: Private payroll growth slowed to 122,000 in July, less than expected, ADP says
item.description: Companies added just 122,000 jobs on the month, the slowest pace since January.

item.title: Euro zone inflation rises to 2.6% in July, above expectations
item.description: Headline inflation in the euro zone unexpectedly rose to 2.6% in July, the European Union's statistics agency said Wednesday.

item.title: Delta CEO says CrowdStrike-Microsoft outage cost the airline $500 million
item.description: Bastian told CNBC's "Squawk Box" on Wednesday that the carrier would seek damages from the disruptions, adding, "We have no choice."

item.title: U.S. crude oil jumps 4% after Hamas leader killed in Tehran
item.description: Iran's claim that Hamas political leader Ismail Haniyeh was assassinated have rekindled tensions in the Middle East, shoring up oil prices.

item.title: HSBC shares rise 3% after profit beat, $3 billion buyback announcement
item.description: HSBC posted a narrow decline in pretax profit in the first half of the year, but beat expectations on the back of a high-interest rate environment.

item.title: Bank of Japan raises benchmark interest rate, outlines roadmap for trimming bond buying program
item.description: The central bank said that it will reduce the monthly outright purchases of JGBs to about 3 trillion yen per month in the January to March 2026 quarter.

item.title: Samsung second-quarter operating profit soars 1,458% as AI demand remains strong; results top estimates
item.description: Samsung Electronics posted higher-than-expected second-quarter revenue and operating profit, as demand for advanced memory chips remained strong.

item.title: TikTok-owner ByteDance's Singapore workers suffer mass food poisoning
item.description: An office of TikTok-owner ByteDance in Singapore was hit by a mass food poisoning incident on Tuesday, according to local authorities.

item.title: Podcast: Samsung bets on the Galaxy Ring and AI as its next big thing
item.description: Samsung this month released the $399 Ring, the South Korean tech giant's first foray into smart rings.

item.title: Microsoft shares dip as cloud miss overshadows better-than-expected revenue and earnings
item.description: Microsoft said it was still supply-constrained for delivering artificial intelligence services to cloud clients. But executives called for cloud acceleration.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: BOJ ups rate to 0.25%; U.S. stocks fall; Starbucks' same-store sales decline
item.description: Japan’s central bank lifted its benchmark interest rate to “around 0.25%” from the previous range of 0% to 0.1%.

item.title: AMD says data center sales more than doubled in a year
item.description: AMD shares are down about 7% year to date, despite the chipmaker being the second largest vendor of data center GPUs after Nvidia.

item.title: Where are China's ultra-rich parking their wealth amid a slowing economy?
item.description: The Chinese ultra-rich population is expected to swell to 144,897 by 2028 from 98,551 in 2023, where are they parking their wealth?
